# Sarah Strochak

Sarah Strochak is a PhD candidate in Public Policy at the Robert F. Wagner School of Public Service at New York University. She works as a Doctoral Fellow at the NYU Furman Center.

Sarah's research is on housing and housing finance. She is interested in how access to credit, housing affordability, and the financial services industry shapes communities. She focuses on bringing data science techniques into the academic research process.
